parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (CMF11240063), which is a strong indicator of electoral propaganda, as it's a mandatory identifier for campaign materials.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions "Alternativa pentru Demnitatea Națională - ADN" and its candidate Ioan Moldovan, specifying his position (20) for the Chamber of Deputies. This directly refers to a parliamentary candidate and party participating in the elections, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - a.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, it's designed to reach a wide audience, not just a select few. The targeting data shows a reach of 100K-500K, further confirming its public nature.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's clear call to action ("Votam...") directly aims to influence voters to choose ADN and Ioan Moldovan.  The objective is explicitly electoral, fulfilling Article 36 (7) - c. The use of paid advertising amplifies this intent.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The content lacks journalistic objectivity. It's a promotional message advocating for a specific candidate, not a neutral presentation of information. It does not adhere to journalistic standards.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>This is not a personal opinion; it's a direct endorsement of a candidate and party, clearly intended to sway voters.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>620144230341700</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda under Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334/2006. It refers to a specific candidate (Ioan Moldovan), is used during the electoral campaign period (although the end date is given as 1732867200, which needs further investigation to determine if it's after the official end of the campaign), has a clear electoral objective (influencing votes for ADN), and is targeted at a wide audience via a paid Facebook advertisement.  The presence of the CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  The argument that it might be educational or journalistic is easily refuted by the explicit call to vote for a specific candidate.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Ioan Moldovan</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>FRP</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Federatia Romanilor de Pretutindeni, pentru incalcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame electorale pe Facebook dupa ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024 (data exacta a incheierii campaniei electorale trebuie verificata), cu ID-ul postarii 620144230341700, care promoveaza explicit candidatul Ioan Moldovan de la Alternativa pentru Demnitate Nationala (ADN) pentru Camera Deputatilor, pozitia 20, cu un buget de 200-299 RON, atingand 20.000-25.000 de impresii si o estimare a raspandirii de 100.000-500.000 de persoane.  Postarea contine un apel direct la vot ("Votam...") si numarul CMF11240063, elemente caracteristice propagandei electorale interzise dupa incheierea campaniei.  Efectul electoral este clar, vizand cresterea numarului de voturi pentru candidatul mentionat.  Informatiile de contact ale advertiserului sunt disponibile in Ad Library: sedecoro@gmail.com si +40774533702.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
